docs.snippet: The penultimate lap of the marathon of World Cup qualifying left little decided with just three certainties: Cameroon, Nigeria and New Zealand advanced to the last 32 in South Africa.

docs.snippet: Algeria bested its rival, Egypt, to earn a spot in South Africa while Greece, Slovenia, Portugal and France advance to the World Cup from Europe. Uruguay and Costa Rica play tonight.
docs.lead_paragraph: Update | 6:00 p.m. France is through to the World Cup in South Africa after William Gallas's controversial goal in extra time helped Les Bleus dash the hopes of a stalwart Ireland side.

headline.seo: A Draw Is Good Enough for Uruguay to Advance
headline.main: Draw Is Good Enough for Uruguay to Advance to Finals
headline.print_headline: Draw Is Good Enough for Uruguay to Advance to Finals

docs.snippet: Uruguay reached the 2010 World Cup finals after a 1-1 draw at home in Montevideo against Costa Rica in the second leg of their South America/Concacaf playoff on Wednesday.     The Uruguayans, two-time World Cup champions, advanced by 2-1 on aggregate...
docs.lead_paragraph: Uruguay reached the 2010 World Cup finals after a 1-1 draw at home in Montevideo against Costa Rica in the second leg of their South America/Concacaf playoff on Wednesday. The Uruguayans, two-time World Cup champions, advanced by 2-1 on aggregate goals after their victory in the first leg in San José on Saturday.
docs.abstract: Uruguay reaches World Cup finals after 2-2 draw against Costa Rica; photo (M)

headline.main: Draw Is Good Enough for Uruguay to Advance to Finals
